rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1d8c954.1503">   <title>Presentations from Axiell ALM user groups meeting </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1d8c954.1503</link>   <description> Hi everyone,<br><br>Some of the presentations from the recent Axiell ALM user groups meeting are now available to view in the File Area of the Adlib-Users Jiscmail account.<br><br>You can find the file area on the right side of the screen once you have logged in and navigated to the Adlib-Users account. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T17:38:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1d8c954.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e3780ad6.1503">   <title>Axiell Users Group Meeting, 24th Feb </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e3780ad6.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>There will be an announcement from Axiell about this imminently, but the chairs of the three UK-based user groups - CALM, Adlib and MIMSY, in consultation with the chair of the Dutch-based Adlib group - thought that we should update people on the broad outline of what was set out during the recent Users Group in Birmingham on 24th February. This is a quick summary: details will follow later this week:<br>At the meeting, Axiell announced a change in direction for the Clover project.<br>Previously, the intention had been to produce a new system that would combine the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:08:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e3780ad6.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8c58869e.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8c58869e.1502</link>   <description> Dear Stephen,<br><br>I am glad that you found the meeting was successful. Thank you very much<br>for the summary; I will look forward to more information!<br><br>Thank you too for undertaking the work to organize a survey, along with<br>Jeroen. It does seem logical to get users' opinions before making changes!<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Peter<br><br>The University of London is an exempt charity in England and Wales [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T08:21:53-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Salt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8c58869e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;eb628b21.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;eb628b21.1502</link>   <description> Hi Peter and Adlib users,<br><br>Sorry you couldn't make it today. I think it was successful, certainly an interesting change of approach announced (summary to follow, hopefully something fairly concrete from Axiell, but I'll summarise too). One obvious flaw was my referring to Birmingham as within the East Midlands, repeatedly, during a presentation on geographic location metadata standards..... A deliberate mistake to test the listeners, maybe? Hmmm. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T17:50:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;eb628b21.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8632c700.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8632c700.1502</link>   <description> Dear Stephen,<br><br>I hope that tomorrow's meeting is successful! Once again, I'm sorry that I<br>won't be there.<br><br>One point that I should have made clear with regard to 3c and the<br>observation that new builds contain more bugs. Someone will surely say that<br>all software contains bugs so that this is inevitable. And that's pretty<br>much true. But what happens when - as has happened to us - the new build<br>contains bugs that make it unusable? This is the situation for us with 7.2<br>- initially step 1 of the search wizard would not find all databases; this<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T10:32:04-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Salt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;8632c700.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;df3cc044.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;df3cc044.1502</link>   <description> Thank you very much for this, Stephen. I think that your idea of a survey<br>is a good one and it's very noble of you to offer to organize one if Axiell<br>don't do one themselves!<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Peter<br><br>The University of London is an exempt charity in England and Wales<br><br>From: Adlib Users [mailto:ADLIB-USERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Stephen<br>McConnachie<br>Sent: 02 February 2015 10:28<br>To: ADLIB-USERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T08:07:02-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Salt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;df3cc044.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;5e5145ce.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;5e5145ce.1502</link>   <description> Thanks Peter,<br><br>I will add it to the agenda for our Adlib meeting, and I have asked Gayle, Ian and Malcolm to confirm whether it is on the agenda for the main meeting.<br>I've recently asked about a customer satisfaction survey around helpdesk support / maintenance SLAs, as I've had my own reasons for concern. I've asked again, and I hope Axiel will propose a structured survey to gather feedback across all applications. If not, I'll propose that I organise one.<br>So, here's my suggested agenda below.<br>All the bestStephen<br>1.\ufffd\ufffdAdlib 7.2 Ian Rowson to present on 7.2 and answer [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T10:28:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;5e5145ce.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1caf8e6c.1502">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1caf8e6c.1502</link>   <description> Thanks, Stephen. I did raise on the combined private list the question of<br>support, and I think that there was enough of a response (albeit not only<br>from Adlib customers) to suggest that it should be on the agenda for 24<br>February somewhere. The response to my message shows that it's not a purely<br>Adlib matter, but it's not clear to me where it can fit in the existing<br>agenda<br>(https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/axiell-alm-adlib-calm-mimsy-xg-combined-user-gr<br>oup-meeting-registration-14512761059 ) unless either Axiell agree to add it<br>somewhere or it is raised in one of the individual product sessions - it<br>would be a shame if it [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-01T11:00:24-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Salt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1caf8e6c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f6bfad5e.1501">   <title>Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f6bfad5e.1501</link>   <description> Hi everyone,<br><br>I thought I'd send a reminder about the Adlib section within the forthcoming Axiell combined user group meeting, and suggest this agenda below.<br><br>Please post back to the group any suggested additions to the agenda.<br><br>All the best<br>Stephen<br><br>1. Adlib 7.2<br>Ian Rowson to present on 7.2 and answer questions.<br><br>2. System integrations (eg digital file storage / management solutions, content management systems for web platforms, etc)<br>Specific area of interest is external thesaurus integration, in particular LOD implementations. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T17:21:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f6bfad5e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;bd723270.1501">   <title>Adlib web application </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;bd723270.1501</link>   <description> Hi Ian,<br><br>Thanks for sending these details through; I'll try and get to this user group event on the 24th.<br><br>In the meantime I have a quick question for you; how are the plans for getting online access to the admin module progressing? We are having issues using Remote Desktop in Network Rail (it was never going to be easy!) and being able to access it online will make our set up and use of the software so much easier. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T11:45:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stretch Vicky</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;bd723270.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;d1e7b42.1501">   <title>FW: Cross Posting to UK listservs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;d1e7b42.1501</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>Apologies for duplicate messages, but I wanted to be sure everyone was aware of the announcement that was posted to the UK listserv and the LinkedIn Group last week.<br><br>Gayle    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T09:19:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;d1e7b42.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e697d81a.1501">   <title>Re: Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e697d81a.1501</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>In the area of system integrations, I'd be interested in hearing/discussing implementing using external thesaurus in Adlib either from another locally hosted database or a web hosted service. We are going to work on a locally hosted implementation in January. However our ideal would be to link in to a web based service, so if anyone has experience on using a linked data thesaurus like the Getty to Adlib I'd be very interested. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T14:09:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>WALSH A.D.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;e697d81a.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;6f59fe13.1501">   <title>Axiell joint user group meeting: agenda for Adlib section </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;6f59fe13.1501</link>   <description> Hi everyone,<br><br>Within the agenda for the Axiell joint user groups meeting in February in Birmingam , there is a section for individual user group meetings for Adlib, Calm and Mimsy.<br><br>So I'd like to gather agenda points for our meeting. I think it may be beneficial to air ideas here with the group rather than emailing only me, as one agenda idea may provoke another. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-12T17:46:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;6f59fe13.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1f1d9e3d.1412">   <title>Important information for Adlib customers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1f1d9e3d.1412</link>   <description> Dear Customer,<br><br>As the festive season is very nearly upon us, on behalf of everyone at Axiell ALM I'd like to take the opportunity to wish you and your colleagues all the best for Christmas and the New Year. Please note the important information given below.<br><br>Christmas Helpdesk Hours<br>The Axiell ALM UK helpdesk will be closed from lunchtime on Wednesday 24th December though to Friday 2nd January 2015. If you have an urgent need for technical assistance over the holiday period, please contact the Dutch helpdesk which will be open every day except 25th and 26th December and 1st [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T10:20:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;1f1d9e3d.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;b6ee6952.1411">   <title>FW: Adlib, Calm, Mimsy XG UK user group meeting registration available </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;b6ee6952.1411</link>   <description> Online registration for our 1-day joint Adlib, Calm, Mimsy XG UK user group meeting in Birmingham on Tuesday, 24 February, 2015 is now available: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/axiell-alm-adlib-calm-mimsy-xg-combined-user-group-meeting-registration-14512761059&lt;https://www.linkedin.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Eeventbrite%2Eca%2Fe%2Faxiell-alm-adlib-calm-mimsy-xg-combined-user-group-meeting-registration-14512761059&amp;urlhash=-Sjc&amp;_t=tracking_anet&gt;.<br><br>The meeting will be held from 10 - 4 at the Crowne Plaza Hotel (http://www.ihg.com/crowneplaza/hotels/us/en/birmingham/bhxpw/hoteldetail<https://www.linkedin.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Eihg%2Ecom%2Fcrowneplaza%2Fhotels%2Fus%2Fen%2Fbirmingham%2Fbhxpw%2Fhoteldetail&urlhash=6A3C&_t=tracking_anet>). There will be no charge for registering for the meeting; however, transportation to / from the meeting will be the responsibility of attendees. At this time, we reserved space for 1 representative per system per site. Depending on registration numbers, we may be able to accommodate additional attendees. If you would like overnight accommodations, please call the hotel at (0) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-27T08:18:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;b6ee6952.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;3ccbbfa8.1411">   <title>FW: Cross Posting for 3rd Party Integration Request </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;3ccbbfa8.1411</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>Recently we have received several inquiries regarding sites who have experience with 3rd party integrations (eCommerce, DAM/MAM, etc.). In order to connect sites who managing similar projects, we would like to compile a list of CMS integrations that Axiell users are deploying. We would greatly appreciate if you would email the following to Gayle Silverman at gayle.silverman@axiell.com&lt;mailto:gayle.silverman@axiell.com&gt;: Organization, Contact, Current System, and Integrated System Name with a subject heading of &quot;3rd Party Integrations.&quot; A brief description of the integration would also be greatly appreciated. Thanks! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-14T14:24:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;3ccbbfa8.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;40a62ccf.1409">   <title>Adlib training courses discounted </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;40a62ccf.1409</link>   <description> Hello all,<br><br>We're having a 'special offer' on our scheduled courses running at the Adlib Training Centre, Swindon!<br><br>The cost of any course booked and attended from now to the end of 2014 will be discounted by 10%, meaning the charge per person, per day will be \ufffd\ufffd250 instead of the usual \ufffd\ufffd275. (ex VAT) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-16T08:50:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;40a62ccf.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;13809a9f.1409">   <title>Advance warning - Combined User Group Meeting - February 24, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;13809a9f.1409</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>Please see the message below regarding the next Adlib/CALM/Mimsy XG user meeting. We had a lot of positive feedback about the last event, so I hope as many organisations as possible will be able to attend.<br><br>Note that I've cross-posted this message from the 'combined' JISCMail list, ADLIB-CALM-MIMSY-MERGED. I strongly recommend you join this list if you haven't already. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-11T09:38:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;13809a9f.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f797cd15.1409">   <title>Re: Best practice for recording books in Adlib Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f797cd15.1409</link>   <description> Hi Gary, The Adlib Library method for recording multiple copies of a book involves creating linked Copy records, which can be done from the Book record. In a Book record, go to the Copies and Shelfmarks tab, there you'll find the Copy Number field, which works as a link to the Copies database - you can create a new Copy record here (adding detail like Shelfmark, Location, Site, Status, etc) and it links to your book record. The Copy Number field is repeatable so you can repeat the process for multiple copies. Hope that helps? All the best Stephen On [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-04T09:21:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;f797cd15.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2bcb74a0.1409">   <title>Best practice for recording books in Adlib Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2bcb74a0.1409</link>   <description> A small village-based museum that I help out with from time to time has a copy of Adlib Museum and has just started recording its modest collection of reference books in the Adlib Library module. One problem the cataloguing team has encountered is there doesn't appear to be a field in which to record a unique identifier for books where multiple copies are held. I am sure this must be an issue that other users of the Adlib software have come across and resolved, so we should be enormously grateful for any advice/best practice on how to properly record in [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-01T20:22:21+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gary Samson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2bcb74a0.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;9dceca07.1407">   <title>Adlib Training Course Schedule for 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;9dceca07.1407</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>Just to let everyone know, the latest schedule of Adlib training courses has now been released for the remainder of 2014, and can be seen at http://www.adlibsoft.com/news/2014courses<br><br>These will probably be the last set of courses which will run in Swindon, as the Training Centre will relocate to the Axiell Head Office in Nottingham in 2015. For that reason, we expect them to fill up quite quickly, so please book early to avoid disappointment. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-31T08:45:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ian Rowson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;9dceca07.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;18bf5377.1407">   <title>Re: Adlib Ingest tool: a presentation at CILIP MmIT conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;18bf5377.1407</link>   <description> That does sound most interesting Stephen. I second that request. :-)<br><br>Best,<br><br>Ailsa<br><br>Ailsa Jenkins<br>Head of Corporate &amp; Collections Information<br>Science Museum Group<br>tel: +44 (0)20 7942 4182<br>mob: 07964 117259<br>email: ailsa.jenkins@ScienceMuseum.ac.uk<br>&lt;mailto:ailsa.jenkins@ScienceMuseum.org.uk&gt;    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-29T17:04:08+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jenkins Ailsa</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;18bf5377.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2eb3c305.1407">   <title>Re: Adlib Ingest tool: a presentation at CILIP MmIT conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2eb3c305.1407</link>   <description> Yes please Stephen \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd please share \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Nicki Thomas<br>Collections Information Officer<br>Economic Development<br>Plymouth City Council<br>Plymouth City Museum &amp; Art Gallery<br>Plymouth<br>PL4 8AJ<br><br>T +441752307673<br>E nicola.thomas@plymouth.gov.uk&lt;mailto:Nicola.Thomas@plymouth.gov.uk&gt;<br>www.plymouth.gov.uk&lt;http://www.plymouth.gov.uk/&gt;<br><br>From: Adlib Users [mailto:ADLIB-USERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Stephen McConnachie<br>Sent: 28 July 2014 14:42<br>To: ADLIB-USERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Adlib Ingest tool: a presentation at CILIP MmIT conference<br><br>I will be presenting on the BFI's use of the Adlib Ingest tool, at the CILIP Multimedia, Information and Technology conference in Sheffield in September: http://www.cilip.org.uk/multimedia-information-and-technology-group/events/mmit-2014-conference. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-29T08:29:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Thomas, Nicki</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2eb3c305.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;78cbbd00.1407">   <title>Crowd sourcing: platforms, methodologies, business cases </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;78cbbd00.1407</link>   <description> In the BFI we're starting to scope a crowd sourcing project based on BFI National Archive moving image collections (and possibly photograph collection).<br><br>We're at a very early stage. For example, we're still defining the ambition: do we want to gather permanently useful knowledge - such as geographic location for film scenes, annotated with timecode - for the BFI's database; or do we simply want to engage existing audiences and potentially new audiences in BFI activities / collections. Or both! [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-28T15:10:04+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;78cbbd00.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item you talk,<br><br>Fabiana<br><br>[RBS Logo]<br><br>Fabiana Barticioti<br>Collections Cataloguer<br>t: +44 (0)20 8392 8440 Ext.423 |<br>Fabiana.Barticioti@royalballetschool.org.uk | www.royalballetschool.org.uk<br><br>Lower School<br>White Lodge \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Richmond Park \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Surrey \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd TW10 5HR<br>t: +44 (0)20 8392 8440 |<br><br>Registered address: 46 Floral Street \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Covent Garden \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd London WC2E 9DA | Registered charity: 214364 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-28T13:49:06+00:00</dc:date> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2222b819.1407">   <title>Adlib Ingest tool: a presentation at CILIP MmIT conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2222b819.1407</link>   <description> I will be presenting on the BFI's use of the Adlib Ingest tool, at the CILIP Multimedia, Information and Technology conference in Sheffield in September:<br>http://www.cilip.org.uk/multimedia-information-and-technology-group/events/mmit-2014-conference<br><br>The presentation is called 'Digitising Collections: Embedded Metadata Mapping and Automated Extraction\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br><br>Essentially it will demonstrate how to use the Adlib Ingest tool (or equivalent in MAM / DAM products of course) to map / extract metadata to generate database records for collections digitisation outcomes, demanualising the workflow to make it scaleable. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-28T14:42:03+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen McConnachie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;2222b819.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;98dc4ba2.1407">   <title>Final Call for Papers: MTSR 2014 - Special Track on Metadata & Semantics for Cultural Collections & Applications </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;98dc4ba2.1407</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Part of the 8th International Conference on Metadata and Semantic Research<br>(MTSR 2014), 27 - 29 November 2014, Karlsruhe, Germany<br><br>Submission deadline: *New Deadline!* July 31st, 2014<br><br>Proceedings will be published in Springer CCIS series<br><br>*AIM AND SCOPE*<br><br>Cultural Heritage collections are essential knowledge infrastructures that<br>provide a solid representation of the historical background of human<br>communities. These knowledge infrastructures are constructed from and<br>integrate cultural information derived from diverse memory institutions,<br>mainly museums, archives and libraries. Each individual community has spent<br>a lot of effort in order to develop, support and promote its own metadata<br>as [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-28T16:01:06+03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lina Bountouri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;98dc4ba2.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;efb05747.1407">   <title>Final call for papers: 2nd Workshop on "Archives in the digital age: standards, policies and tools" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;efb05747.1407</link>   <description> *Apologies for cross-posting*   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-16T13:02:48+03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lina Bountouri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;efb05747.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;525ab56b.1407">   <title>Submission deadline extended: Special Track on Metadata & Semantics for Cultural Collections & Applications </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;525ab56b.1407</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-12T13:36:43+03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lina Bountouri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADLIB-USERS;525ab56b.1407</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
